branch_protection_rule$created.description: Activity related to a branch protection rule. For more information, see "[About branch protection rules](https://docs.github.com/en/github/administering-a-repository/defining-the-mergeability-of-pull-requests/about-protected-branches#about-branch-protection-rules)."
branch_protection_rule$created.title: branch protection rule created event

branch_protection_rule$deleted.description: Activity related to a branch protection rule. For more information, see "[About branch protection rules](https://docs.github.com/en/github/administering-a-repository/defining-the-mergeability-of-pull-requests/about-protected-branches#about-branch-protection-rules)."
branch_protection_rule$deleted.title: branch protection rule deleted event

branch_protection_rule$edited.description: Activity related to a branch protection rule. For more information, see "[About branch protection rules](https://docs.github.com/en/github/administering-a-repository/defining-the-mergeability-of-pull-requests/about-protected-branches#about-branch-protection-rules)."

changes.description: If the action was `edited`, the changes to the rule.

branch_protection_rule$edited.title: branch protection rule edited event

head_sha.description: The SHA of the commit that is being checked.

status.description: The current status of the check run. Can be `queued`, `in_progress`, or `completed`.

conclusion.description: The result of the completed check run. Can be one of `success`, `failure`, `neutral`, `cancelled`, `timed_out`, `action_required` or `stale`. This value will be `null` until the check run has completed.

started_at.description: The time that the check run began. This is a timestamp in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

completed_at.description: The time the check completed. This is a timestamp in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

name.description: The name of the check run.

id.description: The id of the check suite that this check run is part of.

head_sha.description: The SHA of the head commit that is being checked.

pull_requests.description: An array of pull requests that match this check suite. A pull request matches a check suite if they have the same `head_sha` and `head_branch`. When the check suite's `head_branch` is in a forked repository it will be `null` and the `pull_requests` array will be empty.

requested_action.description: The action requested by the user.

identifier.description: The integrator reference of the action requested by the user.

head_sha.description: The SHA of the commit that is being checked.

status.description: The phase of the lifecycle that the check is currently in.

conclusion.description: The result of the completed check run. Can be one of `success`, `failure`, `neutral`, `cancelled`, `timed_out`, `action_required` or `stale`. This value will be `null` until the check run has `completed`.

requested_action.description: The action requested by the user.

identifier.description: The integrator reference of the action requested by the user.

head_branch.description: The head branch name the changes are on.

head_sha.description: The SHA of the head commit that is being checked.

status.description: The summary status for all check runs that are part of the check suite. Can be `requested`, `in_progress`, or `completed`.

conclusion.description: The summary conclusion for all check runs that are part of the check suite. Can be one of `success`, `failure`, `neutral`, `cancelled`, `timed_out`, `action_required` or `stale`. This value will be `null` until the check run has `completed`.

url.description: URL that points to the check suite API resource.

pull_requests.description: An array of pull requests that match this check suite. A pull request matches a check suite if they have the same `head_sha` and `head_branch`. When the check suite's `head_branch` is in a forked repository it will be `null` and the `pull_requests` array will be empty.

alert.description: The code scanning alert involved in the event.

created_at.description: The time that the alert was created in ISO 8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ.`

html_url.description: The GitHub URL of the alert resource.

state.description: State of a code scanning alert.

dismissed_at.description: The time that the alert was dismissed in ISO 8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

dismissed_reason.description: The reason for dismissing or closing the alert. Can be one of: `false positive`, `won't fix`, and `used in tests`.

id.description: A unique identifier for the rule used to detect the alert.

description.description: A short description of the rule used to detect the alert.

name.description: The name of the tool used to generate the code scanning analysis alert.

version.description: The version of the tool used to detect the alert.

ref.description: The Git reference of the code scanning alert. When the action is `reopened_by_user` or `closed_by_user`, the event was triggered by the `sender` and this value will be empty.

commit_oid.description: The commit SHA of the code scanning alert. When the action is `reopened_by_user` or `closed_by_user`, the event was triggered by the `sender` and this value will be empty.

commit_comment$created.description: A commit comment is created. The type of activity is specified in the `action` property.

id.description: The ID of the commit comment.

node_id.description: The node ID of the commit comment.

position.description: The line index in the diff to which the comment applies.

line.description: The line of the blob to which the comment applies. The last line of the range for a multi-line comment

path.description: The relative path of the file to which the comment applies.

commit_id.description: The SHA of the commit to which the comment applies.

commit_comment$created.title: commit_comment created event

create$event.description: A Git branch or tag is created.

ref_type.description: The type of Git ref object created in the repository. Can be either `branch` or `tag`.

master_branch.description: The name of the repository's default branch (usually `main`).

pusher_type.description: The pusher type for the event. Can be either `user` or a deploy key.

create$event.title: create event

delete$event.description: A Git branch or tag is deleted.

ref_type.description: The type of Git ref object deleted in the repository. Can be either `branch` or `tag`.

pusher_type.description: The pusher type for the event. Can be either `user` or a deploy key.

delete$event.title: delete event

state.description: The new state. Can be `pending`, `success`, `failure`, or `error`.

description.description: The optional human-readable description added to the status.

target_url.description: The optional link added to the status.

deployment.description: The [deployment](https://docs.github.com/en/rest/reference/repos#list-deployments) that this status is associated with.

gollum$event.description: A wiki page is created or updated.

action.description: The action that was performed on the page. Can be `created` or `edited`.

sha.description: The latest commit SHA of the page.

html_url.description: Points to the HTML wiki page.

gollum$event.title: gollum event

member.description: The user who's permissions are changed.

changes.description: The changes to the collaborator permissions

from.description: The previous permissions of the collaborator if the action was edited.

scope.description: The scope of the membership. Currently, can only be `team`.

member.description: The [user](https://docs.github.com/en/rest/reference/users) that was added or removed.

scope.description: The scope of the membership. Currently, can only be `team`.

member.description: The [user](https://docs.github.com/en/rest/reference/users) that was added or removed.

hook_id.description: The id of the modified webhook.

hook.description: The modified webhook. This will contain different keys based on the type of webhook it is: repository, organization, business, app, or GitHub Marketplace.

changes.description: The changes to the milestone if the action was `edited`.

from.description: The previous version of the description if the action was `edited`.

invitation.description: The invitation for the user or email if the action is `member_invited`.

hook_id.description: The ID of the webhook that triggered the ping.

app_id.description: When you register a new GitHub App, GitHub sends a ping event to the **webhook URL** you specified during registration. The event contains the `app_id`, which is required for [authenticating](https://docs.github.com/en/apps/building-integrations/setting-up-and-registering-github-apps/about-authentication-options-for-github-apps) an app.

changes.description: The changes to the project if the action was `edited`.

draft.description: Indicates whether or not the pull request is a draft.

from.description: The previous version of the body.

ref.description: The full git ref that was pushed. Example: `refs/heads/main`.

before.description: The SHA of the most recent commit on `ref` before the push.

after.description: The SHA of the most recent commit on `ref` after the push.

commits.description: An array of commit objects describing the pushed commits.

The previous version of the name if the action was `edited`.

prerelease.description: Whether the release is identified as a prerelease or a full release.

from.description: The `edited` event types include the details about the change when someone edits a sponsorship to change the privacy.

The `pending_cancellation` and `pending_tier_change` event types will include the date the cancellation or tier change will take effect.

starred_at.description: The time the star was created. This is a timestamp in ISO 8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`. Will be `null` for the `deleted` action.
The time the star was created. This is a timestamp in ISO 8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`. Will be `null` for the `deleted` action.

id.description: The unique identifier of the status.

target_url.description: The optional link added to the status.

description.description: The optional human-readable description added to the status.

state.description: The new state. Can be `pending`, `success`, `failure`, or `error`.

branches.description: An array of branch objects containing the status' SHA. Each branch contains the given SHA, but the SHA may or may not be the head of the branch. The array includes a maximum of 10 branches.

changes.description: The changes to the team if the action was `edited`.

from.description: The previous version of the description if the action was `edited`.
The previous version of the name if the action was `edited`.
The previous version of the team's privacy if the action was `edited`.

admin.description: The previous version of the team member's `admin` permission on a repository, if the action was `edited`.

pull.description: The previous version of the team member's `pull` permission on a repository, if the action was `edited`.

push.description: The previous version of the team member's `push` permission on a repository, if the action was `edited`.

ref.description: The full Git reference, formatted as `refs/heads/<branch name>`.

analysis_key.description: Identifies the configuration under which the analysis was executed. For example, in GitHub Actions this includes the workflow filename and job name.

environment.description: Identifies the variable values associated with the environment in which the analysis that generated this alert instance was performed, such as the language that was analyzed.

state.description: State of a code scanning alert.

app.description: GitHub apps are a new way to extend GitHub. They can be installed directly on organizations and user accounts and granted access to specific repositories. They come with granular permissions and built-in webhooks. GitHub apps are first class actors within GitHub.

id.description: Unique identifier of the GitHub app

slug.description: The slug name of the GitHub app

name.description: The name of the GitHub app

permissions.description: The set of permissions for the GitHub app

events.description: The list of events for the GitHub app

app.title: App

author_association.description: How the author is associated with the repository.
author_association.title: AuthorAssociation

branch-protection-rule.description: The branch protection rule. Includes a `name` and all the [branch protection settings](https://docs.github.com/en/github/administering-a-repository/defining-the-mergeability-of-pull-requests/about-protected-branches#about-branch-protection-settings) applied to branches that match the name. Binary settings are boolean. Multi-level configurations are one of `off`, `non_admins`, or `everyone`. Actor and build lists are arrays of strings.
branch-protection-rule.title: branch protection rule

check-run-deployment.description: A deployment to a repository environment. This will only be populated if the check run was created by a GitHub Actions workflow job that references an environment.
check-run-deployment.title: Check Run Deployment

distinct.description: Whether this commit is distinct from any that have been pushed before.

timestamp.description: The ISO 8601 timestamp of the commit.

url.description: URL that points to the commit API resource.

added.description: An array of files added in the commit.

modified.description: An array of files modified by the commit.

removed.description: An array of files removed in the commit.

repository_selection.description: Describe whether all repositories have been selected or there's a selection involved

target_id.description: The ID of the user or organization this token is being scoped to.

id.description: Unique identifier of the issue comment

state.description: State of the issue; either 'open' or 'closed'

color.description: 6-character hex code, without the leading #, identifying the color

membership.description: The membership between the user and the organization. Not present when the action is `member_invited`.
membership.title: Membership

milestone.description: A collection of related issues and pull requests.
milestone.title: Milestone

archived.description: Whether or not the card is archived

id.description: The unique identifier of the project column

state.description: State of the project; either 'open' or 'closed'

url.description: URL for the pull request review comment

pull_request_review_id.description: The ID of the pull request review to which the comment belongs.

id.description: The ID of the pull request review comment.

node_id.description: The node ID of the pull request review comment.

diff_hunk.description: The diff of the line that the comment refers to.

path.description: The relative path of the file to which the comment applies.

position.description: The line index in the diff to which the comment applies.

original_position.description: The index of the original line in the diff to which the comment applies.

commit_id.description: The SHA of the commit to which the comment applies.

original_commit_id.description: The SHA of the original commit to which the comment applies.

html_url.description: HTML URL for the pull request review comment.

pull_request_url.description: URL for the pull request that the review comment belongs to.

start_line.description: The first line of the range for a multi-line comment.

original_start_line.description: The first line of the range for a multi-line comment.

start_side.description: The side of the first line of the range for a multi-line comment.

line.description: The line of the blob to which the comment applies. The last line of the range for a multi-line comment

original_line.description: The line of the blob to which the comment applies. The last line of the range for a multi-line comment

side.description: The side of the first line of the range for a multi-line comment.

in_reply_to_id.description: The comment ID to reply to.

number.description: Number uniquely identifying the pull request within its repository.

state.description: State of this Pull Request. Either `open` or `closed`.

title.description: The title of the pull request.

draft.description: Indicates whether or not the pull request is a draft.

maintainer_can_modify.description: Indicates whether maintainers can modify the pull request.

name.description: The file name of the asset.

target_commitish.description: Specifies the commitish value that determines where the Git tag is created from.

draft.description: Wether the release is a draft or published

prerelease.description: Whether the release is identified as a prerelease or a full release.

private.description: Whether the repository is private or public.
Whether the repository is private or public.

disabled.description: Returns whether or not this repository is disabled.

default_branch.description: The default branch of the repository.

allow_squash_merge.description: Whether to allow squash merges for pull requests.

allow_merge_commit.description: Whether to allow merge commits for pull requests.

allow_rebase_merge.description: Whether to allow rebase merges for pull requests.

allow_auto_merge.description: Whether to allow auto-merge for pull requests.

delete_branch_on_merge.description: Whether to delete head branches when pull requests are merged

sponsorship-tier.description: The `tier_changed` and `pending_tier_change` will include the original tier before the change or pending change. For more information, see the pending tier change payload.
sponsorship-tier.title: Sponsorship Tier

team.description: Groups of organization members that gives permissions on specified repositories.

permission.description: Permission that the team will have for its repositories
Permission that the team will have for its repositories

team.title: Team
